\title{vtc\sphinxhyphen{}video\sphinxhyphen{}link\sphinxhyphen{}post}
\date{Sep 14, 2020}
\release{1.0}
\author{MBAMBA FABRICE DAMIEN}

\renewcommand{\releasename}{Release}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


This document describes how to launch the VTC\sphinxhyphen{}VLP application step by step on a local web server.


\chapter{Report of task project}
\label{\detokenize{intro:report-of-task-project}}\label{\detokenize{intro::doc}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Name:}} VTC \sphinxhyphen{} vlp

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{version:}} v1.0

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Description:}} It a simple app that help user to create an account, logged in and store videos links.
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\item[{Register informations:}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Name

\item {} 
User name

\item {} 
Email

\item {} 
Password

\end{itemize}

\item[{Log in information:}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Username

\item {} 
Password

\end{itemize}

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Time taken:}} 2 Hours and 48 minutes

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Technologies used:}} Python 3, Javascript, CSS and HTML

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Team:}} I’m alone (MBAMBA Fabrice Damien)


\chapter{Get Started}
\label{\detokenize{usage:get-started}}\label{\detokenize{usage::doc}}

\section{Python Installation}
\label{\detokenize{usage:python-installation}}
Before use app localy you must install python 3 according to your system requirement.
\begin{description}
\item[{Example:}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
If you have windows installed and it 32 bit you must install python 3 32 bits version (Same method if you have 64 bits version)

\item {} 
If you have Mac you probably have python installed, if not choose mac os python 3 version

\item {} 
Same if you have Linux

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

Now to get download python build visit: \sphinxurl{http://www.python.org/download/} and check with your system os correspondance

When terminate download install and take care to check add parameter of installation directory to your system PATH

If all done, Open your console and set:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n}{python}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

You will get something like this:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Python} \PYG{l+m+mf}{3.7}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{l+m+mi}{8} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{tags}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{v3}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{l+m+mf}{7.8}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{n}{b47a5b6ba}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Jun} \PYG{l+m+mi}{28} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2020}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{08}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{l+m+mi}{53}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{l+m+mi}{46}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{MSC} \PYG{n}{v}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1916} \PYG{l+m+mi}{64} \PYG{n}{bit} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{AMD64}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{on} \PYG{n}{win32}
\PYG{n}{Type} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{help}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{copyright}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{credits}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{license}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{more} \PYG{n}{information}\PYG{o}{.}
\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

It’s all python is installed now correctly, but if you get an error message make a post in stackoverflow forum and you get very fast answer.


\section{PostgresSql Installation}
\label{\detokenize{usage:postgressql-installation}}
Now python is install, you must install postgresSql similary to python according to your system requirement.
To do it browse this and select your according package: \sphinxurl{https://www.enterprisedb.com/downloads/postgres-postgresql-downloads}


\section{Create User and Database}
\label{\detokenize{usage:create-user-and-database}}
Now we have python and postgres installed we must create Database manualy and user of this database(It called role)
The most efficiently tool have postgres is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pgadmin\sphinxhyphen{}browser}} with it we are going fast.
To open pgadmin into your Windows start menu(If you use windows) and select postgres after pgadmin

When open into your browser first select option: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Login/Group Roles}} Like image bellow:

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture1}.png}

Now you must fill field like this:

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{name:}}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{vtcuser}}

Select definition tab into pgadmin

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture2}.png}

and fill field password like so:

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{password:}}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{vtcpass}}

Last tab select privileges like image:

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture3}.png}

Check case \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Can login ?}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Superuser}}

Now the final peace into postgres is to create our database to make it really simple

Select first database option push your right click and select create

New windows appear, first thing to do is to filled field like so:

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{database:}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{vtcdb}}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Owner}} Select \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{vtcuser}}

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture4}.png}

It’all !  Click to save

We have python install and database next the last peace.


\section{Run vtcvlp app}
\label{\detokenize{usage:run-vtcvlp-app}}
Open vtcvlp directory inside your console like this:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{C}\PYG{p}{:}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{Users}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{personal}\PYGZbs{} \PYG{n}{cd} \PYG{n}{vtcvlp}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

If our first time to run app, we need to add requirements library

To do it we must run command

Open vtcvlp directory inside your console like this:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{C}\PYG{p}{:}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{Users}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{personal}\PYGZbs{} \PYG{n}{pip} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{r} \PYG{n}{requirements}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{txt}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Secondly we need to populate our database for do it

Run command \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{python manage.py migrate}} like this:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{C}\PYG{p}{:}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{Users}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{personal}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{vtcvlp}\PYGZbs{} \PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{manage}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py} \PYG{n}{migrate}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Finally

Run command \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{python manage.py runserver}} like this:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{C}\PYG{p}{:}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{Users}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{personal}\PYGZbs{}\PYG{n}{vtcvlp}\PYGZbs{} \PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{manage}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py} \PYG{n}{runserver}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Now to use app we browse it with every browser inside it, in url place we set:

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{localhost:8000}}

Now we can use it.


\chapter{Launching the app}
\label{\detokenize{launch:launching-the-app}}\label{\detokenize{launch::doc}}

\section{First time or not}
\label{\detokenize{launch:first-time-or-not}}
If this is your first time to launch the application,
then know that you should first launch your browser example for me it’s chrome and once launched go to the urls area and type: \sphinxtitleref{localhost:8000}

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture5}.png}

Once entered press the Enter key.
That’s it.

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture6}.png}

You should register first before you can post a link to click on the register button.

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture7}.png}

Once the registration form is correctly filled in go to your console and select the generated registration confirmation link because remember you are on a server running locally.

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture8}.png}

Paste this link on the URL field and press Enter.
Then click on the button to confirm your registration
Now login with your username or e\sphinxhyphen{}mail address and then your password and click on the login button.

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture9}.png}

Now that you are connected, click on the three vertical buttons on your right you will have a modal window then finally indicate the name of your link and its address, finally click on the save button.
Now you have just recorded your first video link.
That’s all you have to do

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=670\sphinxpxdimen,height=520\sphinxpxdimen]{{capture10}.png}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a
many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}one relation.

In the example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{parent} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ForeignKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{related\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{children}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Parent.children}} is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ReverseManyToOneDescriptor}} instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager
class built by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_forward\_many\_to\_many\_manager()}} defined below.

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{poster (vtcuser.models.VideoLink attribute)@\spxentry{poster}\spxextra{vtcuser.models.VideoLink attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{vtcvlp:vtcuser.models.VideoLink.poster}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{poster}}}
Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}one or
one\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{parent} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ForeignKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{related\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{children}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Child.parent}} is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ForwardManyToOneDescriptor}} instance.

\end{fulllineitems}

CustomUserSerializer class
A \sphinxtitleref{ModelSerializer} is just a regular \sphinxtitleref{Serializer}, except that:
* A set of default fields are automatically populated.
* A set of default validators are automatically populated.
* Default \sphinxtitleref{.create()} and \sphinxtitleref{.update()} implementations are provided.

\section{Views modules:}
\label{\detokenize{vtcvlp:module-vtcuser.views}}\label{\detokenize{vtcvlp:views-modules}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!vtcuser.views@\spxentry{vtcuser.views}}\index{vtcuser.views@\spxentry{vtcuser.views}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{vtcvlp:vtcuser.views.VideoLinkAPIView.authentication_classes}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{authentication\_classes}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ = {[}\textless{}class \textquotesingle{}rest\_framework\_jwt.authentication.JSONWebTokenAuthentication\textquotesingle{}\textgreater{}{]}}}}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_queryset() (vtcuser.views.VideoLinkAPIView method)@\spxentry{get\_queryset()}\spxextra{vtcuser.views.VideoLinkAPIView method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{vtcvlp:vtcuser.views.VideoLinkAPIView.get_queryset}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_queryset}}}{}{}
Get the list of items for this view.
This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset.
Defaults to using \sphinxtitleref{self.queryset}.

This method should always be used rather than accessing \sphinxtitleref{self.queryset}
directly, as \sphinxtitleref{self.queryset} gets evaluated only once, and those results
are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different
querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_queryset() (vtcuser.views.VideoLinkPostRudView method)@\spxentry{get\_queryset()}\spxextra{vtcuser.views.VideoLinkPostRudView method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{vtcvlp:vtcuser.views.VideoLinkPostRudView.get_queryset}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_queryset}}}{}{}
Get the list of items for this view.
This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset.
Defaults to using \sphinxtitleref{self.queryset}.

This method should always be used rather than accessing \sphinxtitleref{self.queryset}
directly, as \sphinxtitleref{self.queryset} gets evaluated only once, and those results
are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different
querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

\end{fulllineitems}
